creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by H. Ed Robison, in memory of his beloved wife Ulrike Pietzner Robison
description: standing woman in lavender sweatshirt and blue pants stands with arms down against hips, legs together in front of an octagonal, pillared structure; woman is standing on wide path lined with trees and lamps; in middle ground at R, set of stone stairs leads to a verandah with wrought iron railing in front of the octagonal structure; building has scalloped design around roof and a tall spire with weathervane
inscription: Bottom, in pencil: [ＡＹＯＭＩ のいる風景Ａ] {Ayomi no iru fūkei, A} (Scene with Ayomi A); bottom, in pencil: [21/50] [Hodaka Yoshida \'79]
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
title: Scene with Ayomi, A
